page.title: 19THE GRAVEL PITS
page.content: Around North Scarle and Eagle there are a lot of Gravel pits.Some are disused now but most are still worked. The sand and gravel is dug out for the building trade. The farmers sell the mineral rights to the gravel Firms who then dig out all the sand and gravel.The power stations from across the Trent, dump all their ash from the furnaces in the disused pits.When they are full.The old soil which has been saved,is put over all the ash and the farmer then grows his crops on the reclaimed land. Some of the disused gravel pits are bought by water sports clubs and are used for sailing, wind surfing,fishing and water skiing They are very dangerous places and we are warned not to go near.We all learn to swim at school.
